Posts.Content: Thank you. Janine13 and dreamthief. I do have such a lot of great friends around me that all want to help but I have always been an independent person who would never ask for help so it adds to my anxiety about the situation.  chemo will probably start the beginning of sept so joining that group would be good. I cannot lie I am still trying to work out how this all works not that best at computer type stuff. i am really scared of the chemo side and everyone just goes on about having a positive mind and of course they are right but it all just freaks me out.  i feel so drained already that's before I have even started the chemo. xx
Posts.Title: Any Triple Negative survivors willing to calm me down!!??

Posts.Content: Hi I was diagnosed with grade 3 triple negative on the 4th June. I have had a lumpectomy and sentineol node biopsy on the 27th June and it was node positive so I went for a full axillary clearance which came back clear. i am now just waiting for my start date for chemo which will be 6 cycles of fec-t I am dreading this part as I have 3 young children 1 of which has Aspergers.  I feel really down and fed up extremely tired after my second op which was on the 31st July still in discomfort and don't feel able to drive.  Feels extremely odd writing this as I am not on any other social network but feel fed up as I do t think people say stupid things that don't really make me feel much better..
Posts.Title: Any Triple Negative survivors willing to calm me down!!??

Posts.Content: Hello lizzy I have had 2 fec so far and I notice that I get breast pain and also it feels like my scar is tightening up a few days after chemo, must confess I thought this was rather odd and had played on my mind a bit so glad you asked the question and j your response makes perfect sense now.. eleanor
Posts.Title: Breast pains during chemo

Posts.Content: Hi I went for counselling yesterday as I am really struggling with going through chemo. I think you have done so great finishing chemo.. Well done. I left yesterday's session with a huge wait lifted as I think everyone around you tries to hard to say postive things you end up feeling that your feelings are wrong. I am defiantly going for more and reckon when I finish with the therapist she will need counselling after listening to me go on...  Everybody has their own opinions and it's hard for our husbands too but I realise cancer consumes the person who has it we don't get a break from it everyone else around us does..   Good luck with your next stage  Eleanor x
Posts.Title: Feeling so angry tired and weak

Posts.Content: Thank you Mumra I have just rang her and left a message i do kind of want to do stuff but I feel very drained all the time and everything seems a lot of effort. I have 3 children who are extremely hard work which is making me feel more tired .
Posts.Title: feeling fed up and down

Posts.Content: Hi pj I have lots of days when I feel very down. I met with my ocoligist last weds and they said I would be contacted in 2 to 3 days with a date to start my chemo and I haven't heard anything. I just want to be able to plan ahead.  It seems like all you do is wait. I am dreading this next part of treatment so I feel very anxious and just want to get on and do it.. every one says I should be going out and doing stuff but I still feel quite tired all the time as I had 2 ops a month apart and I am not sleeping well either . X
Posts.Title: feeling fed up and down

Posts.Content: Hi all. My children are 8 11 and 15. My 11 year old has Aspergers and ADHD so she is very hard work and difficult to please.  The bcn rang me back and explained that my oncologist has been away this week.. She said that if I haven't heard by next weds then I am to contact her again and she will chase it up for me.  Thanks all for your help I am liking the idea of a soak in the bath and a glass of wine. It's difficult for me to get someone to have all 3 and obviuosly my husband has been busy trying to get as much work done so he can have any time off that is needed when my chemo starts.  X
Posts.Title: feeling fed up and down

Posts.Content: Ah thank you so much Kathy.. This afternoon we went down to the Beach hut and had a little bar b q. It took me 2 hrs to persuade a screaming child to walk down and join in but I got there in the end.  It's been difficult the mast few months. Everyone has had their holidays so we have felt quite isolated and alone trying to juggle everything.  Good to know I have support here thank you  Eleanor x
Posts.Title: feeling fed up and down

Posts.Content: Hi all. the beach hut is a nice place to spend time it's just a shame that my middle daughter makes going down there such hard work as its a relaxing place to spend time and all the people that have beach huts are like family without all the baggage..  I have been so tired today it seems to be getting worse although today I did give chores out to my children, they wasn't happy but I felt it wasn't fair they were all lazing around..  I think pj that people don't know what to do or say when you show that you are upset as deep down they know they can't fix it.. I sometimes just want them to agree that it's just shit.. Because it is isn't it ?  Xxx
Posts.Title: feeling fed up and down

Posts.Content: Hi... Think I am a long way away from you all but I might have a perfect venue for a beach party.......  I begin my chemo journey on weds.. Don't think I have ever felt so afraid of anything ever..  Thinking of you all. eleanor xxx
Posts.Title: coming out of that dark tunnel.

Posts.Content: Hi giglingertie I was a grade 3 triple negative had a lumpectomy 27th of June 2015 and 2 sentinol nodes removed to which 1 contained high levels of cancer cells. I was offered the clinical trial to keep remaining lymph nodes and have extra radio therapy to them but I choose to have them all removed as I wanted to take every precaution I can to prevent my cancer returning. None of the 26 nodes removed did contain cancer cells but I still feel it could have gone the other way and I didn't want to take any chances. I had my 6 cycles of chemo then went on to have 20 sessions of radiotherapy.  At this present moment in time I don't really have any major issues with my arm at all. It all feels a bit tight but I can pretty much use it the same as before it is maybe a bit weaker but then that's how I feel generally at the moment any way. I know other people are left with problems and I could be on here at any time asking advise because I have ended up with fluid or problems but I still know that I did it for the right reasons and for me it was another step to making sure I'm cancer free. Eleanor x
Posts.Title: Lymph node surgery

Posts.Content: Hi. I have never been told my stage either. Just that it was a grade 3. eleanor x
Posts.Title: stage/ tiering system confusion

Posts.Content: Hi... I want my hair back too... I hate the way I look.. Everyone says it's fine and I look ok but it's not me and I think I have forgotten who I was before which scares me the most. I finished last chemo on weds, I have 20 sessions of radiotherapy to start in a few weeks.. My youngest brother took a photo of us all together on Christmas night and put it on face book.. I'm not on face book but have been told.. I didn't want any photos either but after thinking about it all maybe the photo being taken is going to be part of the final healing process.. We can maybe look back when our hair is in our eyes and realise how well and far we have come. Hope that helps  Eleanor x
Posts.Title: I'm not 'me'

Posts.Content: Hi I start my chemo on weds the 16th and hope to make my gene test on Friday the 18th I have 2 daughters so feel it's very important I find out if I carry the gene. And same as you don't want to ever go through this again if I don't have to so would have all removed to give me a better chance of being cancer free. good luck with your last chemo and hope you get your negative result . thinking of you  eleanor x
Posts.Title: Been a while again but on 6th and final chemo

Posts.Content: Hi issingbass  I am having rt at the moment and just finished week 3 have one more week to go. I have been very tired a lot more than expected but I did have chemo. I do however seem to have a bit of energy in the mornings where I can get bits done and prepare dinner etc it's the afternoons after treatment I feel so tired and washed out.. I have 3 children who are quite demanding but I'm lucky I don't work. May be that could be an option for you work for a few hrs??? And if needed rest up after treatment.  Everyone is so different and of course the travelling has to be taken into account I'm about 40 mins away from the hospital so doing the journey ever day is tiring enough. Take care and good luck  Eleanor x
Posts.Title: How many people worked through RT? Is it doable ?

Posts.Content: Hi all I to used aloe Vera gell  a neighbour brought it for me and it was really soothing, I only ended up with 1 burn patch on my collar bone where I forgot religiously to rub gell on but after a couple of days it went down and is now just a bit itchy.. Hospital didn't give me any creams at all. Forever products is where mine came from and my very kind neighbour brought me an aloe drink to help heal the insides too..  Take care  Eleanor X
Posts.Title: Advice for radiotherapy burns

Posts.Content: Hi I got quotes from lots of company's and aviva were really competitive so I went with them. A family of 5 and I also have a daughter with a health condition too was £247 world wide annual including the Caribbean. I would only take out the premium policy for piece of mind worth paying in the beginning and covering everything I say. Eleanor xx
Posts.Title: Travel insurance recommendations for Europe

Posts.Content: I suppose so, it's the base of it on the bone, it's getting worse they are not numb to touch kind of like when they get really cold but obviuosly they are not.  Eleanor x
Posts.Title: JANUARY CHEMO CLUB

Posts.Content: Hi misty I had 3 fec and 3 t. I lost all my hair by day 20 of my first cycle but kept my eyelashes until after my first T. Had last chemo on the 30th of Dec and am still losing my eyebrows but hair on the rest of my body is starting to grow back and have a fair covering on my head too. Nails are also beginning to fall off too now but are not sore and already have new nail underneath. Started rads on the 25th Jan and feel the most tired I have ever been and extremely breathless. Everyone is so different. Take care of yourself  Eleanor x
Posts.Title: fec - t

Posts.Content: Hi all... I'm on day 14 of my last chemo which was t.. I feel very tearful all the time and still have little energy so everything is an effort.. Oddly my big toes are feeling quite odd I can't really explain exactly but it's stopping me from getting to sleep and making driving a bit awkward, has anyone else had something similar ? Hope everyone is coping ok.  Eleanor x
Posts.Title: JANUARY CHEMO CLUB

Posts.Content: Thank you so much dreamthief for getting back to me. I will see how it goes.. Is there anything that might help that I can do now.?  Thanks again  Eleanor
Posts.Title: JANUARY CHEMO CLUB

Posts.Content: Hi it's ok I have spoken to the breast care nurse and she has gone through it all with me. xxx
Posts.Title: Confused about histology report

Posts.Content: hi just got my full report from the oncologist it reads  27.5mm grade 3 IDC plus high grade DCIS, triple negative biology. 1/2 marometastases hot node and blue node. now the bit that confuses me is the plus high grade DCIS ?? Can anyone help me as I feel bad phoning the breast care nurse  thank you
Posts.Title: Confused about histology report

Posts.Content: I will have 2 at the secrondry school which is 30 mins away in the car and my son at primary which is only a 10 min walk so it was going to be a bit difficult but felt it could be done but now I am not so sure. i also need to point out I am not sure my way round joining the group chats etc and adding friends it takes me ages to work out every time I log on. The primary school have been amazing support as I used to help out there so most of the teachers are like friends anyway. The secondry school have been very supportive of my eldest daughter so far and I have had meetings regarding my next daughter with the senco and she has been placed in the same community as her which helps. i just wish they would hurry up and give me my date now so I can plan as best I can. Sarahj48i suppose your the best to answer all our worries regarding this part of treatment. I have never felt so scared.. I had all my 3 children with no pain relief as I am so anti drugs of any description and now going to be pumped full of them..
Posts.Title: Young children

Posts.Content: Sorry to ask Sarah but was it fec-t you had? How are you feeling now you are at the end of your treatment?  Eleanor. X
Posts.Title: Young children

Posts.Content: Hi. Warrior k. I have 3 young children my middle daughter has Aspergers and is due to start secondry school next week. I am waiting for my start date to for chemo. It's been a bit difficult not being able to drive through the summer holidays and especially now the weather has turned. i to have mixed emotions and feel quite down about how it's all going to work when the chemo starts. I met with my oc last weds so literally just waiting for a date which will be within 2 week.  X
Posts.Title: Young children

Posts.Content: It would be great to support each other. I have a son who is 8 and amazing. My daughter who has Aspergers and ADHD is 11 and my eldest is 16 in sept and confused to why we are not having a house party for her birthday this year. i am really worried about my daughter going to secondry school as I had to committed to taking her there as our local secrondry school is not very good so she is traveling to the same school my eldest got a maths scholarship into so she was able to go but I don't feel she is able to travel on the school buses that operate. i am dreading the chemo as the girls are both such hard work at the best of times. My 16 year old daughter is extremely lazy and selfish so she offers little help and does not try and get along with her sister.  I am a planner but my husband is a wait and see what happens person. xxx
Posts.Title: Young children

Posts.Content: Hi I had full axillary clearance on the 31st of July and it still all feels very tender and sore. I drove today for the first time and it Was very uncomfortable and now feels quite painful. I also feel at times if I try and go out for longer periods of time quite faint and unwell. It was my second op as had a wle on June 27th. I am due to start my chemo soon and don't realily want them to delay it but not sure if I should mention it to them when I have  my next appointment. i also am not sure wether to persevere with the driving as my children are going back to school tomorrow and I need to drive them there but worried I might do more damage. think my husband is keen for me to drive also although it hasn't been to much of a problem for him, eleanor
Posts.Title: Still in discomfort

Posts.Content: Hi Karen.. I drove again today and it still hurts but going to persevere as I don't want my middle daughter having to get on the school bus.. Olivia has been very agitated and actually a complete nightmare but all went ok this morning but I think that was because her dad was about he normally has to leave very early but as it was her first day at secrondry school he organised things so he could work local. i got my chemo start date today it's going to be the 16th....... Thank you crystaljuju very helpful.. I have to go on the 14th for my pre chemo chat so at least I know what to expect now. I am having fec-t.. Got 2 weeks now to get organised and hopefully fit a few things in... I have planned to get some scarves I am not sure about the wig thing at the moment.... But I might feel different later on.. I am a hairdresser and just can't face the thought of going wig shopping. My daughter has offered to lend me her dress up wigs but think they may not suit me.  How did you go today Karen?
Posts.Title: Still in discomfort

Posts.Content: Hi Judith  thank you very much for the link. I have given it to her but unfortunately I know she won't look at it. She is quite selfish and at the moment going on about how unfair it is that she can't have a house party for her birthday this year. thanks again  Eleanor xx
Posts.Title: Still in discomfort

Posts.Content: Hi chloecat45 thank you for your help it's not really the seat belt that is a problem it's changing gear and turning the sterling wheel. i have been able to do most things for a while some things pull a bit like pegging out washing but as you say maybe after a few times it might get better.  There is no swelling or hotness around the scar actually it has healed well just feels so raw and tendor all around the area and around my back. I suppose it's to be expected really isn't it.. I do just want to get on with my chemo now I was hoping to hear as I have had the first appointment and agreed to it etc. I am fine doing house stuff and walking the dog but if we go out maybe to the shops or anything to much I just feel faint after a while and I got worried today as I keep getting an aching pain at the side of my head and my vison is blurry at times. I suppose it could be blood pressure it's been a bit stressful with my middle daughter she has Aspergers and ADHD so is very full on. well thank you for all your help  xxx
Posts.Title: Still in discomfort
